messages.content: 9-1-1, what's your emergency?
Yeah, hi. I have a kind of a particular emergency here.
My cat attacked our seven-month-old child, and I kicked the cat in the rear, and it has gone off the edge. We aren't safe around the cat.
It's a very large Himalayan, and we're trapped in our bedroom. He won't let us out of the door.
Okay. Does the child need medical attention?
No. He has some marks on his forehead, but the cat, we don't know what to do about the cat. He's trying to attack us. He's very, very hostile. I tried to get hold of animal control.
Hang on just a second. You guys are inside your bedroom right now?
Yeah. And if I leave the bedroom to let the police in, I'm going to have to fight this cat.
Hang on just a second. When you say the cat is large, how large?
22 pounds, maybe.
What's the address there? What apartment number?
[address redacted]
I need to put you on hold for just a moment to run something by my supervisor, but I'll be right back, okay? Don't hang up.
Alright.
And you said your child does not need medical attention, right?
No, he's just got a couple of small punctures.
Okay, and do you think the cat is ill?
I don't know. I think the cat has a history of violence. He's kind of a violent cat already.
He's charging us. He's at our bedroom door.
One moment, okay?
You hear him?
I hear him. Hold on, keep your door shut, okay? If you need anything, call us back. Help is on the way.
Alright, thank you.
You're welcome.
